intro: Argostemma bifolium, commonly known as the two-leaved argostemma, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
